titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the O'Mahoney family academic certificates 1988.005
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:09:26 +0000.

did.abstract: Certificates and diplomas issued to members of the O'Mahoney family of Brooklyn, including Anna, Catherine, Mary, and May O'Mahoney, for passing various stages of academic achievement during the period 1906 to 1925. Some certificates issued to Anna and Catherine O'Manhoney give them license to teach at the grade school level. Most of the certificates are issued by the Department of Education of the City of New York, as well as St. Francis Xavier's Academy and various other primary and secondary schools.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); O'Mahoney family academic certificates, 1988.005, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1988.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.
